title: History of the Broken Isles

metadata.Key Event: Battle of the Broken Straits (~118 years ago)

epigraph: Before The Storm, we were prey. After The Storm, we became the hunters.
atAGlance:
The Broken Isles weren't always unified. For generations, they were scattered‚Äînative orcs and goblins, desperate refugees, independent pirates preying on each other as much as the mainland.

Then the Thelassian came to finish their genocide.

118 years ago, a massive Imperial fleet sailed east to destroy the pirate havens and hunt down escaped drow. They found Vaelith Draegor waiting. The Storm united every captain, every clan, every desperate soul who had nowhere else to run.

The Battle of the Broken Straits destroyed the Empire fleet. 30+ warships sunk. The survivors begged Vaelith to be king. He refused.

*"I don't want your throne. I want the sea. Choose your own king."*

They did. The Confederation was born. And The Storm has watched over it ever since.

*Common saying: "The Isles belong to whoever sits the throne. The throne belongs to The Storm."*

---
commonKnowledge:
### The First Peoples (Ancient)

Before outsiders arrived, the islands were already inhabited:
- **Orcs** on Stormcrag (farming, raiding, clan feuds)
- **Goblins** on Greenfire Isle (early shipbuilding)
- **Bugbears** in Mistwood (hunting, ruins)

Where they came from is lost to time. They simply were.

### The Refugee Era (~200-120 years ago)

As mainland persecution intensified, desperate people fled to the Isles:
- Kingdom commoners fleeing noble rule
- Drow escaping the genocide
- Half-breeds rejected by both societies
- Criminals, deserters, the desperate

Integration was rough. The First Peoples didn't welcome invaders. But shared enemies‚Äîthe mainland powers‚Äîeventually created common ground.

### The Scattering (~120-118 years ago)

For decades, the Isles had no unity:
- Pirates preyed on each other
- No safe harbors
- Mainland powers picked off ships one by one
- Every captain for themselves

### The Empire's Wrath (~118 years ago)

The Thelassian decided to end the drow escape route permanently. Emperor Valandor authorized a purge fleet: 40+ warships, thousands of soldiers, orders to show no mercy.

Word reached the Isles. Panic spread. Individual captains couldn't fight a fleet.

### The Storm Rises

[Vaelith Draegor](/npcs/vaelith-the-storm-draegor) had sailed these waters for 180 years, destroying Empire ships but ignoring Isles politics. This time was different. The Empire was coming for drow‚Äîfor his people.

He sailed into Freehold Harbor and called every captain to gather:

> *"The Empire comes to finish what they started. We fight, or we die‚Äînot today, but soon, one by one. I will fight. Those who sail with me will have the protection of The Storm."*

Every captain chose to fight.

### The Battle of the Broken Straits

~100 pirate vessels against 40 Imperial warships. Vaelith used local knowledge to force the Empire into narrow channels where numbers meant nothing.

**Result:** 30+ Imperial ships destroyed. The survivors fled. The drow they came to hunt watched their hunters drown.

### The Founding

After the battle, captains begged Vaelith to rule. He refused:

> *"Choose your own king. Make your own laws. I will be here if the Empire returns."*

The first Moot established:
- The Pirate Monarch (elected)
- Harbor Peace (Vaelith's demand)
- Tribute system for collective defense
- Freehold as capital

### Since Then

**~60 years ago:** Saltmere founded as commercial capital
**~20 years ago:** Gorrath unites orc clans
**~3 years ago:** Graza Bloodtide becomes Queen

The Confederation has endured 118 years. Monarchs rise and fall. The Storm remains.

---
secretKnowledge:
### Why Vaelith Refused the Crown

The official story: He wanted the sea, not power.

**The deeper truth:** Vaelith saw what crowns did. The Empire's emperor has ruled for 1,500 years, and look what the Empire became. The Kingdom's king barely controls his lords. Power corrupts. Thrones demand compromise.

By refusing to rule, Vaelith kept himself pure. He answers to no one. He compromises nothing. He can destroy the Empire with single-minded focus.

**The strategic genius:** By refusing power, he gained more than any crown could give. Everyone owes him. No one can challenge him. He rules by not ruling.

### The Lost First Monarch

The name of the first Pirate King is genuinely lost. Some say it was deliberate‚ÄîVaelith ordered the name forgotten so no dynasty could claim descent.

Others say the first monarch was... unremarkable. Chosen to fill a role, not for greatness. The Confederation needed a figurehead. They got one. He died. No one remembered.

### What Vaelith Did Before

180 years between his escape and the Battle. What did he do?

**The truth:** He hunted. Every Empire ship that strayed too far east. Every slaver. Every naval patrol. He learned the waters. He built his fleet one captured ship at a time. He became a legend before he ever appeared at Freehold.

**His kill count:** Unknown, but estimates range in the hundreds of ships over those decades. The Empire knows. They don't talk about it.

### The Saltmere Conspiracy

The official history says three merchants founded Saltmere together.

**The truth:** Vaelith suggested it. Not directly‚Äîthrough intermediaries. He saw the Confederation needed economic stability to survive. He nudged the right people toward the right opportunity. The founders think it was their idea.

It was his.

### The Empire's Silence

Why hasn't the Empire tried again in 118 years?

**What most believe:** Fear of The Storm.

**What Vaelith suspects:** The Empire is waiting. Building strength. Planning. The next attack will be overwhelming‚Äîor not come at all. Valandor is patient. 118 years is nothing to an immortal.

**The truth Vaelith doesn't know:** Valandor has considered it many times. Each time, his advisors talk him out of it. The risk is too high. The cost too great. And somewhere in his ancient heart, Valandor wonders if the drow haven't suffered enough.

### Plot Hooks

| Hook | Description |
|------|-------------|
| **The First Monarch's Name** | Someone claims to have found records of the first Pirate King. What does the name reveal? Why was it hidden? |
| **The Storm's Log** | Vaelith kept records during those 180 years alone. His early logbooks still exist. What's in them? |
| **The Saltmere Papers** | Evidence emerges that Vaelith orchestrated Saltmere's founding. Does this change anything? |
| **The Empire Returns** | After 118 years, the Empire is building a new fleet. Is this the final confrontation? |
| **Before the Battle** | Flashback adventure: the desperate days before the Storm rose. What were the PCs' ancestors doing? |

### The Real Foundation

The Confederation exists because of fear. Not fear of enemies‚Äîfear of Vaelith.

Every monarch knows: rule poorly, and The Storm might care. Every captain knows: break Harbor Peace, and The Storm will respond. Every settlement knows: threaten the Confederation, and The Storm is the Confederation's response.

He doesn't need to act. The possibility of action is enough.

**This is why the Isles work:** Not because the system is good, but because everyone fears what happens if it fails.
